millsfield:images_texts:
SAFETY IS OUR FIRST
CONSIDERATION
We want you to know about
the various safety features on
this airplane. The steward-
ess will advise during the
pre-departure announce-
ment the type of aircraft you
are aboard, whether it is a
Boeing 727, Douglas DC-8
or Lockheed Electra II. After
you review the EMERGEN-
CY INSTRUCTIONS
on
Pages 2 through 8, turn to
the section pertaining to the
aircraft type for specific in-
structions on the operation
and location of EMERGENCY
EXITS and CABIN DOORS,
OPERATION of EVACUA-
TION SLIDES, and OPERA-
TION of the OXYGEN SYS-
TEM which are.applicable to
the aircraft you are aboard.
NATIONAL AIRLINES
EMERGENCY
INSTRUCTIONS
Government regulations require
that instructions explaining the
procedures for Emergencies be
provided for the information of
the passengers.
PLEASE DO NOT REMOVE THIS BOOKLET FROM THE AIRCRAFT

NATIONAL AIRLINES
Government Regulations require that instructions explaining the procedures
for emergencies be provided for the information of passengers.
